And also by donating to @endstigma, as well.
Anyway. I want to be more open about it all this year and hope to help the bigger conversation about mental in some way.
I don't want to contribute to stigmatization by bottling it all up. I don't want people to be scare to talk about it, like I was / still am.
This is the first I've really spoken about it. I am on a better combo of medication this year that has made the problems way more manageable
I finally went to my doctor and went on meds; they weren't the right ones for me initially. I was afraid to tell my parents? And friends.
I had a bad nite on the couch. I called Emma, and she taught me to rub my fingers on the couch and focus on the texture to stop the attack.
I drank alone in my basement a lot to try and self-medicate; a mistake. Watching @ChrisGethard taping-streams helped me cope in a major way.
2+ years ago I started having panic attacks at night; like my heart would explode. I couldn't sleep in my room, I'd go to the couch instead.
This year, I'm going to try hard to get better at not bottling my anxiety/depression internally while also calling for de-stigmatization.
